entities.characters

Class AbstractChar

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.Entity
      • entities.characters.AbstractChar
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Char

    public abstract class AbstractChar
extends Entity
    The AbstractChar class does most of the behind-the-scenes work for the Character portion of the combat system, including inventory management and combat actions.
    Author:
    Dr. Cheese

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class entities.Entity

        dead, dying

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> encounter)
      The AbstractChar .act() method runs through each duration in the durations ArrayList and lowers the value by 1, removes any effects if necessary, prints out a status line, then asks the player for input.
      void addBonus(AbstractTimedConsumable a)
      This method adds a timed consumable to the character's ArrayList of bonuses, then runs the .addDuration() method on the same consumable.
      void addXP(int XPval)
      Adds an amount of XP equal to the amount inputted to the AbstractChar's XPtotal.
      void attack(Entity other)
      "Attacks" the target Entity by calculating a damage value and then making the target's current HP equal to their previous current HP minus that damage value.
      void clearEffects()
      This method clears the AbstractChar's bonuses ArrayList and the durations ArrayList.
      void die(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> actors)
      This method checks if the AbstractChar is dead already, and if it is not it removes the AbstractChar from the encounter ArrayList.
      boolean equals(Entity other)
      Checks if the other Entity is equal to this Entity by checking if it is an instance of AbstractChar, then checking the value of each stat across both AbstractChars.
      void equip(int i)
      This method checks if the item in the specified slot in the inventory is a weapon, then runs the equip(Weapon newWeapon) method if it is.

      This method lets the character equip a weapon in their inventory.

      The fully abstracted equip method.

      This method adds an item to the character's inventory at the end.

      Sets the XP total of the AbstractChar to a new value.

      This method constructs and then returns a string containing the entirety of the character's inventory in list form.

      This method prints out the status string to the console.

      Tells what the character's name and stats are.

      This method lets a character use a consumable they have in their inventory.
      int XPtotal()
      Finds and returns the XP total of the AbstractChar.

    • Constructor Detail

        public AbstractChar()

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public final void get(Item a)
        This method adds an item to the character's inventory at the end.
        Parameters:
        a - The item to be added.

      • equip

        public final void equip(Item a)
        This method lets the character equip a weapon in their inventory. It checks a couple things, based on the specified item. First, it checks if the item is in the character's inventory. Secondly, it checks if the item is a Weapon. If both of those conditions return true, it will run the .equip(Weapon newWeapon) method. If one or both of those conditions returns false, it will print out a message stating what was wrong.
        Parameters:
        a - The item to check on/be equipped
        See Also:
        equip(Weapon), equip(int)

      • equip

        public final void equip(int i)
        This method checks if the item in the specified slot in the inventory is a weapon, then runs the equip(Weapon newWeapon) method if it is.
        Parameters:
        i - the slot to check/equip
        See Also:
        equip(Weapon), equip(Item)

      • equip

        public final void equip(Weapon newWeapon)
        The fully abstracted equip method. Simply sets the current weapon to a new one specified as the parameter.
        Parameters:
        newWeapon - The weapon to be equipped.

      • use

        public final void use(Consumable a)
        This method lets a character use a consumable they have in their inventory. It checks the character's inventory for a consumable that matches the one specified, then if it finds it it has the Consumable run its .apply() method on this AbstractChar.
        Parameters:
        a - the consumable to check for/use.
        See Also:
        addBonus(AbstractTimedConsumable), act(ArrayList)

      • addBonus

        public final void addBonus(AbstractTimedConsumable a)
        This method adds a timed consumable to the character's ArrayList of bonuses, then runs the .addDuration() method on the same consumable.
        Parameters:
        a - The AbstractTimedConsumable to add to the bonuses ArrayList.
        See Also:
        addDuration(AbstractTimedConsumable)

      • attack

        public final void attack(Entity other)
        "Attacks" the target Entity by calculating a damage value and then making the target's current HP equal to their previous current HP minus that damage value. It then prints out a statement letting the console know that this Character did X amount of damage to "its target entity".
        Specified by:
        attack in class Entity
        Parameters:
        other - the entity that is the target of the attack.
        See Also:
        planAttack(ArrayList)

      • showInventory

        public final java.lang.String showInventory()
        This method constructs and then returns a string containing the entirety of the character's inventory in list form.
        Returns:
        A string containing the contents of the character's inventory, with a label.
        See Also:
        get(Item), equip(Weapon)

      • act

        public final void act(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> encounter)
        The AbstractChar .act() method runs through each duration in the durations ArrayList and lowers the value by 1, removes any effects if necessary, prints out a status line, then asks the player for input. Depending on what the player inputs, the character will do a variety of different things.
        Specified by:
        act in class Entity
        Parameters:
        encounter - the encounter the Entity is currently in.
        See Also:
        planAttack(ArrayList), status(), use(Consumable)

      • clearEffects

        public void clearEffects()
        This method clears the AbstractChar's bonuses ArrayList and the durations ArrayList. It is meant to be used at the end of a combat encounter.

      • status

        public void status()
        This method prints out the status string to the console.
        See Also:
        statusString()

      • die

        public void die(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> actors)
        This method checks if the AbstractChar is dead already, and if it is not it removes the AbstractChar from the encounter ArrayList.
        Specified by:
        die in class Entity
        Parameters:
        actors - The encounter ArrayList
        See Also:
        Entity.checkForDeath()

      • XPtotal

        public int XPtotal()
        Finds and returns the XP total of the AbstractChar.
        Returns:
        the XPtotal of the AbstractChar.

      • setXPtotal

        public void setXPtotal(int newTotal)
        Sets the XP total of the AbstractChar to a new value.
        Parameters:
        newTotal - the new value for XPtotal to be set to.

      • addXP

        public void addXP(int XPval)
        Adds an amount of XP equal to the amount inputted to the AbstractChar's XPtotal.
        Parameters:
        XPval - The amount of XP to add.
        See Also:
        setXPtotal(int)

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Entity other)
        Checks if the other Entity is equal to this Entity by checking if it is an instance of AbstractChar, then checking the value of each stat across both AbstractChars.
        Parameters:
        other - The other entity to check for equivalency.
        Returns:
        True if everything is equal, and false if otherwise.

      • toString

        public final java.lang.String toString()
        Tells what the character's name and stats are.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        See Also:
        status(), statusString()
